title: Medicinal cannabis prescriptions delayed for 10 weeks as patients miss out on pain relief in final days
text:
Patients prescribed medicinal cannabis are missing doses because they are having to wait up to three months for the drugs to arrive, campaigners have warned.

Importers of the tightly-controlled medication are calling on ministers to allow them to stockpile "emergency" supplies to avoid patients being forced to take breaks in the middle of courses.

The United Patients Alliance, which represents users of medicinal cannabis, said patients with chronic conditions were facing "shocking" waiting times for drugs prescribed by the NHS.
